snippets.title: Applications getApplication Sample
snippets.description: Gets information about an application.

snippets.title: Applications createApplication Sample
snippets.description: Creates an App Engine application for a Google Cloud Platform project. Required fields: * `id` - The ID of the target Cloud Platform project. * *location* - The [region](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/locations) where you want the App Engine application located. For more information about App Engine applications, see [Managing Projects, Applications, and Billing](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/python/console/).

snippets.title: Applications updateApplication Sample
snippets.description: Updates the specified Application resource. You can update the following fields: * `auth_domain` - Google authentication domain for controlling user access to the application. * `default_cookie_expiration` - Cookie expiration policy for the application. * `iap` - Identity-Aware Proxy properties for the application.

snippets.title: Applications repairApplication Sample
snippets.description: Recreates the required App Engine features for the specified App Engine application, for example a Cloud Storage bucket or App Engine service account. Use this method if you receive an error message about a missing feature, for example, *Error retrieving the App Engine service account*. If you have deleted your App Engine service account, this will not be able to recreate it. Instead, you should attempt to use the IAM undelete API if possible at https://cloud.google.com/iam/reference/rest/v1/projects.serviceAccounts/undelete?apix_params=%7B"name"%3A"projects%2F-%2FserviceAccounts%2Funique_id"%2C"resource"%3A%7B%7D%7D . If the deletion was recent, the numeric ID can be found in the Cloud Console Activity Log.

snippets.title: Applications listAuthorizedCertificates Sample
snippets.description: Lists all SSL certificates the user is authorized to administer.

snippets.title: Applications getAuthorizedCertificate Sample
snippets.description: Gets the specified SSL certificate.

snippets.title: Applications createAuthorizedCertificate Sample
snippets.description: Uploads the specified SSL certificate.

snippets.title: Applications updateAuthorizedCertificate Sample
snippets.description: Updates the specified SSL certificate. To renew a certificate and maintain its existing domain mappings, update `certificate_data` with a new certificate. The new certificate must be applicable to the same domains as the original certificate. The certificate `display_name` may also be updated.

snippets.title: Applications deleteAuthorizedCertificate Sample
snippets.description: Deletes the specified SSL certificate.

snippets.title: Applications listAuthorizedDomains Sample
snippets.description: Lists all domains the user is authorized to administer.

snippets.title: Applications listDomainMappings Sample
snippets.description: Lists the domain mappings on an application.

snippets.title: Applications getDomainMapping Sample
snippets.description: Gets the specified domain mapping.

snippets.title: Applications createDomainMapping Sample
snippets.description: Maps a domain to an application. A user must be authorized to administer a domain in order to map it to an application. For a list of available authorized domains, see [`AuthorizedDomains.ListAuthorizedDomains`]().

snippets.title: Applications updateDomainMapping Sample
snippets.description: Updates the specified domain mapping. To map an SSL certificate to a domain mapping, update `certificate_id` to point to an `AuthorizedCertificate` resource. A user must be authorized to administer the associated domain in order to update a `DomainMapping` resource.

snippets.title: Applications deleteDomainMapping Sample
snippets.description: Deletes the specified domain mapping. A user must be authorized to administer the associated domain in order to delete a `DomainMapping` resource.

snippets.title: Applications listIngressRules Sample
snippets.description: Lists the firewall rules of an application.

snippets.title: Applications batchUpdateIngressRules Sample
snippets.description: Replaces the entire firewall ruleset in one bulk operation. This overrides and replaces the rules of an existing firewall with the new rules. If the final rule does not match traffic with the '*' wildcard IP range, then an "allow all" rule is explicitly added to the end of the list.

snippets.title: Applications createIngressRule Sample
snippets.description: Creates a firewall rule for the application.

snippets.title: Applications getIngressRule Sample
snippets.description: Gets the specified firewall rule.

snippets.title: Applications updateIngressRule Sample
snippets.description: Updates the specified firewall rule.

snippets.title: Applications deleteIngressRule Sample
snippets.description: Deletes the specified firewall rule.

snippets.title: Applications listInstances Sample
snippets.description: Lists the instances of a version. Tip: To aggregate details about instances over time, see the [Stackdriver Monitoring API](https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/ref_v3/rest/v3/projects.timeSeries/list).

snippets.title: Applications getInstance Sample
snippets.description: Gets instance information.

snippets.title: Applications deleteInstance Sample
snippets.description: Stops a running instance. The instance might be automatically recreated based on the scaling settings of the version. For more information, see "How Instances are Managed" ([standard environment](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/python/how-instances-are-managed) | [flexible environment](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/python/how-instances-are-managed)). To ensure that instances are not re-created and avoid getting billed, you can stop all instances within the target version by changing the serving status of the version to `STOPPED` with the [`apps.services.versions.patch`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions/patch) method.

snippets.title: Applications debugInstance Sample
snippets.description: Enables debugging on a VM instance. This allows you to use the SSH command to connect to the virtual machine where the instance lives. While in "debug mode", the instance continues to serve live traffic. You should delete the instance when you are done debugging and then allow the system to take over and determine if another instance should be started. Only applicable for instances in App Engine flexible environment.

snippets.title: Applications listServices Sample
snippets.description: Lists all the services in the application.

snippets.title: Applications getService Sample
snippets.description: Gets the current configuration of the specified service.

snippets.title: Applications updateService Sample
snippets.description: Updates the configuration of the specified service.

snippets.title: Applications deleteService Sample
snippets.description: Deletes the specified service and all enclosed versions.

snippets.title: Applications listVersions Sample
snippets.description: Lists the versions of a service.

snippets.title: Applications getVersion Sample
snippets.description: Gets the specified Version resource. By default, only a `BASIC_VIEW` will be returned. Specify the `FULL_VIEW` parameter to get the full resource.

snippets.title: Applications createVersion Sample
snippets.description: Deploys code and resource files to a new version.

snippets.title: Applications updateVersion Sample
snippets.description: Updates the specified Version resource. You can specify the following fields depending on the App Engine environment and type of scaling that the version resource uses: **Standard environment** * [`instance_class`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.instance_class) *automatic scaling* in the standard environment: * [`automatic_scaling.min_idle_instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.automatic_scaling) * [`automatic_scaling.max_idle_instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.automatic_scaling) * [`automaticScaling.standard_scheduler_settings.max_instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#StandardSchedulerSettings) * [`automaticScaling.standard_scheduler_settings.min_instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#StandardSchedulerSettings) * [`automaticScaling.standard_scheduler_settings.target_cpu_utilization`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#StandardSchedulerSettings) * [`automaticScaling.standard_scheduler_settings.target_throughput_utilization`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#StandardSchedulerSettings) *basic scaling* or *manual scaling* in the standard environment: * [`serving_status`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.serving_status) * [`manual_scaling.instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#manualscaling) **Flexible environment** * [`serving_status`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.serving_status) *automatic scaling* in the flexible environment: * [`automatic_scaling.min_total_instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.automatic_scaling) * [`automatic_scaling.max_total_instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.automatic_scaling) * [`automatic_scaling.cool_down_period_sec`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.automatic_scaling) * [`automatic_scaling.cpu_utilization.target_utilization`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#Version.FIELDS.automatic_scaling) *manual scaling* in the flexible environment: * [`manual_scaling.instances`](https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/admin-api/reference/rest/v1/apps.services.versions#manualscaling)

snippets.title: Applications deleteVersion Sample
snippets.description: Deletes an existing Version resource.
